column4: hello, having trouble finding help with this virtualbox issue it seems new. I can't use the seamless mode for the ununtu 12.04 guest OS and vbox 4.1.14 in win7. guest additions installed. Anyone have suggestions?
what happens when you switch to seamless mode?
it goes into fullscreen like mode but I suspect it's half enabled or something as the mouse cursor is still the win type not ubuntus
as luck would have it I run Ubuntu 12.04 with that same VirtualBox version and I have a Win7 professional VM.
I think you're doing the reverse to me by the sounds of it.  win7 is my main Host OS
You're right.  I am doing the reverse of you.
so close ;)
Seamless mode still won't change the mouse cursor though.
At least not until you move the cursor over a seamless window that is running a windows application that changes the cursor.
it's as if the background is not being disabled
does unity havea  3d and 2d mode ?
You mean your gnome background?
yes. In seamless I should be able to see that only the program windows.
shouldnt*
in vbox should ubuntu list the GFX driver as Unknown?
I have a Linux VM I could try seamless on, but it's not Ubuntu...
It might be a virtualbox bug.
if you could just give it a quick go that should help
4.1.14 must be very new out I will roll the vbox additions back to 4.1.12 that's i nthe repo
I tried it with Centos 5.8 on top of Ubuntu in seamless mode and it hid the CentOS guest's background for me.
However, I wouldn't want to use this because I quickly ran into an issue where I couldn't click on Ubuntu windows while it was running.
All of my mouse clicks were going to the VM until I pulled it out of seamless mode.
ok thanks for trying, my centos 6.2 doesn't let me seamless mode currently, maybe I'm missing a driver its quite fresh.
